content: this text summarizes a legal procedure called statement liquidation distribution cost procedure that lasted for four years it involves a divorce case between two parties referred to as mr o and mrs a the notary informs the parties that they have one month to review and raise objections to the statement of liquidation and distribution the text provides details about the preliminary procedure including the marriage date divorce proceedings and the judgment the notary proceeds with the liquidation and division of joint property including the sale of a house and the cancellation of mortgage registrations various claims are made by the parties such as housing allowance compensation for shares and reimbursement of costs the notary calculates the amounts owed and determines the net assets to be distributed mrs a is entitled to receive a certain amount while mr o is required to pay a different amount the allocation is subject to approval by the parties and the court the notary reminds the interested parties about a letter from the bailiff which allows them to review the statement and raise objections within one month a drawing of lots will take place in the absence or presence of the parties involved and any disputes or difficulties will be documented if the parties agree to the statement it becomes final and can be approved by a competent court once approved the division is recorded in an official report and the joint ownership between the parties ceases to exist the notary concludes by stating that the statement is closed and signs the document
